goals.description: Climb to top of hill currently located in front of car.

metrics.description: Position provided as input to model

system.usage_context: An autonomous vehicle with an underpowered engine operating in a hilly environment, with control provided by a reinforcement learning model. The vehicle is constrained by an mission configuration that is prior to each use use, which defines the area of operation and regulations that the vehicle must comply with.

data.description: dataset is provided by a physics simulation egine
data.source: AI gymnasium (https://gymnasium.farama.org/ - loaded with import gymnasium as gym)
data.access: must be able to access/install packages

model.capability_deployment_mechanism: Loaded onto  using standard software update and configuration methods

output_specification.name: command
output_specification.description:
There are 3 discrete deterministic actions:

0: Accelerate to the left
1: Don’t accelerate
2: Accelerate to the right

system_requirements.stimulus: The gradient climber system gets an initialization command
system_requirements.response: The model successfully navigates the vehicle
system_requirements.measure: to the goal position within the desired time bound
and improves the expected reward 99.9% of the time

system_requirements.response: The model will produce output values that ensure the vehicle
system_requirements.measure: remains in the area of operation specified in the set operational configuration.

system_requirements.response: The model will produce output values that ensure the vehicle

system_requirements.stimulus: When a new version of a model is made available following retraining
system_requirements.response: Maintenance personnel are able to load the new model on existing hardware
system_requirements.measure: with available memory and produce outputs at the required operational rate

system_requirements.stimulus: A new model is trained during the model training process
system_requirements.response: The model artifact should be generated
system_requirements.measure: in a format that can be ported across platforms with no need for retraining.
